intro: Acetosella yapacaniensis, commonly known as the Yapacani sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a distinctive sour taste due to the presence of oxalic acid. Acetosella yapacaniensis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
